intro: Eriospermum mackenii subsp. mackenii, commonly known as the Cape sugarbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has a woody stem and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often covered in a fine, white pubescence. It is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
